snippet: As long as income from investments is taxed at a lower rate, there will be no stopping the search for ways to pay the lower rate.
abstract: Editorial argues that the federal government should do away with the special 15 percent tax rate for capital gains, which encourages private equity firms, like Bain Capital, and others in the financial industry to find intricate and sometimes evasive ways of paying the lower rate.
lead_paragraph: As long as income from investments is taxed at a lower rate, there will be no stopping the search for ways to pay the lower rate.
